comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: LT R.L. "Bob" Peters' P-38L "Lady Madie" of the 80th Fighter Squadron "Headhunters," 8th FG. Peters was officially credited with one confirmed aerial victory.

comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: I have another image of the same bird showing a fixed landing light in the left wing leading edge - I thought that didn't happen until the "L" variant - can you clarify?

comment.author: 89986708@N06
comment._content: The gun camera on the nose (visible on another photo of this airplane) indicates older model than P-38L-1. The P-38J-25 was first with a dive flaps and the last with the gun camera on the nose. The landing light in the leading edge was mounted in the latest airplanes of this model. Sorry for my English ;-)

comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: Your English is fine with me - and thank you for the clarification. I had noted the camera port in the nose, but seeing the landing light in the wing just caused me to presume it was automatically an "L."

comment.author: 89986708@N06
comment._content: Some field modifications of a gun camera's placement were sometimes made on previous versions of P-38's being still in the service when the P-38L-1 was already introduced, and sometimes these airplanes looks like having two gun cameras- in the nose tip and with a left pylon.
